instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2779: What is 820-2779? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2779</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message:
CORRECT MOTHERBOARD NR:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight on LCD... Where should I start to measure?

1. Computer starts up. I have fan spin and chime. But no image! The screen is black, no apple logo when using light on the screen.
2. I have 12,6v on F9800 (for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>.
3. <RESISTOR>R9715</RESISTOR> shows 180k, <RESISTOR>R9731</RESISTOR> shows 200k.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2779</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message: There will never be backlight of there is no image. Voltage on <CAPACITOR>C9010</CAPACITOR>? Known good LCD assembly? Was this liquid?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2779</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message:
No Title

[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 38252"]There will never be backlight of there is no image. Voltage on <CAPACITOR>C9010</CAPACITOR>? Known good LCD assembly? Was this liquid?[/QUOTE]


<CHIP>U9000</CHIP> Pin: 4 & 5 (Shows 0v).. Should be 3.4v. I think the IC is broken? On the otherside of the IC, i get correct volt.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2779</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message: I asked about <CAPACITOR>C9010</CAPACITOR>. If LCD is not recognized <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> will never turn on either.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2779</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 38406"]I asked about <CAPACITOR>C9010</CAPACITOR>. If LCD is not recognized <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> will never turn on either.[/QUOTE]

Yes, sorry Duke.. 

The <CAPACITOR>C9010</CAPACITOR>: I get 27.5V..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2779</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message: Also: J900 (pin 4) on the LVDS connector shows 27.5V..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2779</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message: Look at schematic and tell me what voltage should be there. Pretty impossible to have 27V there and if it is really there then it is VERY bad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2779</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 38548"]Look at schematic and tell me what voltage should be there. Pretty impossible to have 27V there and if it is really there then it is VERY bad.[/QUOTE]

The voltage on <CAPACITOR>C9010</CAPACITOR> shows 27v.. I have NO FAN spin now as well. Its gone. So where should I check first. Guess I need to trace everything back.. But where to start is FAN doesnt turn on? <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>..??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2779</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message: 27V is not possible! Especially not when the fan is not even spinning. How are you measuring this?
